{{see also|Evolutionary ethics|Evolution of morality}}
 
Evolutionary ethics concerns approaches to ethics (morality) based on the role of evolution in shaping human psychology and behavior. Such approaches may be based in scientific fields such as [[evolutionary psychology]] or [[sociobiology]], with a focus on understanding and explaining observed ethical preferences and choices.<ref>[http://www.iep.utm.edu/e/evol-eth.htm Evolutionary ethics]</ref>
 
Evolutionary ethics concerns approaches to ethics (morality) based on the role of evolution in shaping human psychology and behavior. Such approaches may be based in scientific fields such as [[evolutionary psychology]] or [[sociobiology]], with a focus on understanding and explaining observed ethical preferences and choices.<ref>[http://www.iep.utm.edu/e/evol-eth.htm Evolutionary ethics]</ref>
  +   +
==Military ethics==
  +
The military ethics is a set of practices and philosophy to guide members of the armed forces to act in a manner consistent with the values and standards, and to clarify with regard to the whole nation and other nations these benchmarks. It deals with issues relating to justification for using force, which may be justified to do in the context of the use of this force.
